longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of machine-readable temporary or emergency
  passports. 

Visa required. 

Visa Issuance:
- E-visas can be applied for at 
      www.evisa.gov.zw .Visitors must hold a valid
  confirmation letter. The visa will be issued on arrival for
  a max. stay of 30 days. Fee varies per number of days of
  intended stay.
    
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of French West Indies will be
  expected to hold their own passport or National ID Card
  (where applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia,
  Cyprus, Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists from November through June in the whole
  country below 1200 m and throughout the year in the Zambezi
  valley. In Harare and Bulawayo, the risk is negligible.
  Recommended prevention in risk areas: C.
